condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Schools’ resilience and pupils’ safety is enhanced through improved disaster preparedness and response, including a rapid reopening of schools after an emergency/disaster

description.narrative: Madagascar is sensitive to climatic hazards and recurrent epidemics. The resilience of the system is low due to poverty and other contextual factors. UNICEF has supported emergency response; 55,377 students were beneficiaries from the Education Cluster. To improve resilience, UNICEF supports preparedness and prevention and systematic communication with government and other partners. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: % children in schools vulnerable to disease outbreak reached with appropriate epidemic prevention materials
